text: Talk with Kafka alone

title: Mission Description
content: The Matrix of Prescience runs at full power to simulate Kafka's past and unveil her goal, but Fu Xuan receives an unbelievable answer — TheStellaron Huntershave nothing to do with theStellarondisaster currently unfolding on the Xianzhou. In fact, the Stellaron Hunters came to save Xianzhou.Shocked, the master diviner hands over Kafka to you as promised. Perhaps Kafka can answer some of your burning questions.

text: (Talk toMarch 7th, optional)

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ You go, (Trailblazer). I don't wanna talk to that woman.

speaker: March 7th
line: Be careful though. Don't get fooled by her again.

text: Are you kidding? I'm an expert now.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Huh, I wouldn't go that far.

text: Got it. Fool me twice, shame on me.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: ...Fool you what now? Ugh, stop it, I'm getting Fu Xuan vibes.

text: Nah, you're the one more likely to get fooled.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Ha, I'm the queen of vigilance, thank you very much. I don't trust anyone except Dan Heng , Mr. Yang , Himeko , and you.

text: (Talk to March 7th again)

speaker: March 7th
line: Be careful. Don't get fooled by her again.

text: (Talk to Welt Yang, optional)

speaker: Welt
line: If there are questions you want Kafka to answer, now's the time.

text: There are so many things I want to ask...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Then go. We'll stand guard.

text: Actually, I don't have anything to ask her.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: You don't want to know about her motives and your past?

text: Is there anything you want to know?

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: There are many things I want to know — but they can wait.

text: (Talk to Welt again)

speaker: Welt
line: What will Kafka have to say to you? I'm curious to find out myself.

text: (Approach Kafka)

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ Hi, (Trailblazer).

speaker: Kafka
line: ...You haven't changed a bit.

speaker: Kafka
line: I'm sorry you have to see me in such a sorry state.

text: Don't act like we're friends.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Fine, if you prefer. Not friends.

text: Are you alright? Are you hurt?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Concerned about me? I'm fine, the Xianzhou is always courteous with its captives.

text: You don't look like you're in a sorry state to me...

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Really? That's good. I wouldn't want to affect your image of me.

speaker: Kafka
line: I didn't talk to you on the train because I knew you and I would get to talk alone here. Worth waiting for, don't you think? You seem to have a lot to ask me.

text: What is your objective?
Are you really innocent?
What did Fu Xuan see?

speaker: Kafka
line: ... Elio said he foresaw three questions, but they would be the same in essence. If I were to hear one of them, I would then tell you the objective of this trip in all its detail.

speaker: Kafka
line: Since you asked one of the three questions, it means everything is going smoothly. Are you ready to hear my answer?

speaker: Kafka
line: Xianzhou's Stellaron problem is not directly linked to us. But if you look at it from Elio's perspective, you can't say the Stellaron Hunters are completely innocent. We foresaw all this long ago, but chose to remain indifferent until the time was right for us to get involved.

speaker: Kafka
line: Diviner Fu was surprised because she discovered three truths: One, the Stellaron Hunters are not enemies of the Xianzhou. You know this now, though you refused to believe it.

speaker: Kafka
line: Two, someone else brought the Stellaron into the Xianzhou and activated it — a result of internal unrest and external aggression. Traitors on the Luofu and enemies from outside want to overthrow the Xianzhou. The master diviner is in a hurry to find the general, presumably to inform him of this fact.

speaker: Kafka
line: However, that's all the master diviner knows, because Elio withheld key pieces of information from me. He foresaw the Divination Commission using the Matrix of Prescience against me. To guard against setbacks, he ensured that I knew only what he wanted the Xianzhou Alliance to know in this moment.

speaker: Kafka
line: As for number three, even in their wildest dreams, the Xianzhou Alliance could never have guessed it, haha... If the Stellaron Hunters aren't the cause of all this, then why are Bladie and I even here?

speaker: Kafka
line: ...We're here for you.

text: For... us?
You're lying.
(Remain Silent)

speaker: Kafka
line: Sounds ridiculous, doesn't it? It's no wonder Fu Xuan doesn't believe it either. But the Matrix of Prescience doesn't lie. The answer is just that bizarre: The Stellaron Hunters appearing here, Bladie getting arrested, me being lured to the Matrix of Prescience... it was all to bring you, the Astral Express crew , to the Xianzhou.

speaker: Kafka
line: In the future that Elio chose, the power of The Hunt is indispensable. That's why the Astral Express crew had to come to the Luofu and achieve something important for the Xianzhou. You had to establish a connection with the Alliance...

speaker: Kafka
line: ...and that's why I had to trick you into coming here. I needed you to meet the Luofu's general in person and help him resolve the Stellaron crisis. I needed the Alliance to owe you a favor. That way, in the future, at the most critical moment, the Xianzhou will offer you their help.

speaker: Kafka
line: What do you think? Surprised? The notorious Stellaron Hunters did all that just to make you a hero of the Xianzhou... Quite the plot twist, don't you think?

text: What is this future you're talking about?
You're lying.
Why are you helping me?
Media:Trailblaze Mission Wood Sprouts Anew, Fate Tilts Askew.mp4

speaker: Kafka
line: Like I said: Elio withheld key pieces of information from me. The future holds endless possibilities. Knowing the right thing at the wrong time could spoil all our hard work.

speaker: Kafka
line: There is only one thing I can tell you about the future: In the best and the worst cases, you will eventually have to face Nanook the Destruction . When that time comes, you will need all the help you can get. It will be a brutal struggle of Aeonic proportions...

speaker: Kafka
line: ...proportions that neither you, nor I, nor the Astral Express will ever be able to reach. In the vast majority of futures, that's when destiny ends. But if we follow Elio's plan, there may be a glimmer of hope on the horizon.

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ ...You know, (Trailblazer), even Aeons can be killed.

text: In the meantime...
Concurrently, at the other end of the Luofu...

speaker: Sushang
line: Hey, Luocha , you didn't finish telling us about the Propagation ! Keep going — it's interesting. So Aeons can die, huh? Weird, I thought THEY were invincible...

speaker: Luocha
line: There is no true invincibility or immortality in the world — such exaggerations are born of the perspectives of ordinary beings. Nonetheless, ordinary beings could not have orchestrated the fall of the Propagation... That Aeon was slain at the hands of another Aeon.

speaker: Sushang
line: ...I don't understand. They're all Aeons, why do they want to fight?

speaker: Luocha
line: You... Are you really from the Xianzhou!? Other Aeons aside, surely you must know the story of Lan and Yaoshi ? Isn't destroying the Aeon Yaoshi the Alliance's cherished aim?

speaker: Sushang
line: Of course, I know! Well, I know a little. My mum made me practice with swords all day — I didn't really go to school...

speaker: Luocha
line: In that case... let's just change the subject. If you don't know about the feud between The Hunt and the Abundance , I'm afraid there's just too much to explain.

speaker: Sushang
line: Fine, how's this for a subject — what's in the box?

speaker: Luocha
line: Oh... this one? It's a casket, more commonly known as a coffin. It's for containing the remains of the deceased.

speaker: Sushang
line: The deceased... A—Aren't you a merchant?

speaker: Luocha
line: Yes indeed, this is just part of my job. I was asked to deliver this coffin to the Xianzhou. Ah, I'd quite forgotten — for long-life species , death is probably a distant concept?

speaker: Sushang
line: Nope. The Cloud Knights spend a lot of time on the battlefield — death is a common occurrence. It's just, we don't put bodies in boxes — uh — coffins... In Xianzhou, people go to the Hall of Karma in the Ten-Lords Commission and consecrate the names and jade abacuses of the dead. It's our way of saying goodbye.

speaker: Sushang
line: The foxians and the Vidyadhara have their own ceremonies. foxian [ sic ] soldiers place their dead in Starskiffs and then let them drift out into the stars. They call it "the Verdantia Returning."

speaker: Sushang
line: As for the Vidyadhara, they're... more mysterious. They say that when a Vidyadhara is very old or has a fatal injury, they turn into an egg that looks like a pearl. When the shell breaks, they come out looking young again...

speaker: Sushang
line: My mum calls the Vidyadhara " Long 's Scions." When I was young, she told me stories of how the Vidyadhara could turn into dragons. I don't know if that's true...

text: It's true.
Only special Vidyadhara can turn into dragons.
It's just a legend.

speaker: Sushang
line: What do you know? Silent but deadly speaks.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: ...Your mother is right. The Vidyadhara are Long's Scions. They are descendants of the Aeon of Permanence . That was why some, but not all, could turn into dragons.

speaker: Dan Heng
line: The power was a rare inheritance, passed down only to those who could successfully complete numerous rites and challenges. For the inheritor, it was hard to say whether it was a blessing or a curse.

speaker: Luocha
line: ...I've heard the story of Long the Permanence and THEIR descendants. Many myths and legends praise the Aeon for a rich and immortal life.

speaker: Luocha
line: But for some reason, the Aeon disappeared among the stars without a trace — almost as if THEY had never existed... leaving only THEIR descendants.

speaker: Luocha
line: Every life has its limit. Even the Aeons are not truly immortal and will eventually reach the end of their lives.

speaker: Sushang
line: Uh, let me ask you one more question... Do you know the person in the coffin?

speaker: Luocha
line: Huh... Yes.

speaker: Sushang
line: Friend?

speaker: Luocha
line: No.

speaker: Sushang
line: So, uh... a sweetheart?

speaker: Luocha
line: Haha, miss, whatever gave you that impression? The individual in the coffin is neither friend nor relative — we met only once. By chance, I made someone a promise, and so I have to run this errand.

speaker: Luocha
line: Let's leave it at that, shall we? I think we've all had enough rest.

text: (Begin sub-missionTranquil Amidst Turmoil)
(After Tranquil Amidst Turmoil is completed)
Meanwhile in the Divination Commission...

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ ...You know, (Trailblazer), even Aeons can be killed.

text: So your plan is... to kill an Aeon?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Ha, are you kidding? That's not what we want.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: I just want to tell stories from the past: Stories about Aeons that have fallen.

text: Killing an Aeon? Humans don't have that power.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: That's right, it would be impossible for a human...

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ...but then I didn't bring humans into the picture, did I?

text: How could an Aeon possibly be killed?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Is it so unthinkable? There are many stories about fallen Aeons.

speaker: Kafka
line: Long the Permanence , Idrila the Beauty , Ena the Order , Tayzzyronth the Propagation ... Akivili the Trailblaze .

speaker: Kafka
line: These names were once known all over the universe. Now, THEY've all but disappeared, leaving behind only masterless Paths .

speaker: Kafka
line: Currently, there are three ways an Aeon can perish known to humanity.

speaker: Kafka
line: One: Paths with overlapping concepts will eventually collide, and the broader Path will engulf the narrower one. That's how Ena the Order was assimilated by Xipe the Harmony .

speaker: Kafka
line: Two: In a war between Aeons, the stronger side will annihilate the weaker one — that's how Tayzzyronth the Propagation fell. Under the guidance of The Hunt, the Xianzhou Alliance travels the universe exterminating " abominations " cultivated by the Abundance...

speaker: Kafka
line: ...so the Xianzhou too are engaged in this process.

text: Why does the Xianzhou want to kill the Abundance?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: As far as I know, the predecessors of the Alliance were the Elixir Seekers . They searched for Yaoshi and longed for the blessing of immortality. When they eventually found the Aeon, they received a blessing that did indeed prevent death — the Ambrosial Arbor .

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ...But immortality turned out to be a curse for the Xianzhou. That's when The Hunt appeared — firing an arrow and felling the Ambrosial Arbor. Ever since, the Alliance has followed The Hunt in pursuit of Yaoshi, erasing the curse of immortality from the universe along the way.

text: How did Tayzzyronth die?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: After the disappearance of Long the Permanence, Tayzzyronth divided the Aeon's Path. In the process, Tayzzyronth became a new Aeon known as the Propagation. My understanding is that Tayzzyronth, or "Imperator Insectorum" to some, didn't last long...

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: ...When the Swarm Disaster began to take hold, Tayzzyronth was attacked and killed by multiple Aeons.

text: What about Akivili? Did THEY die at the hands of an Aeon?

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: I don't know. Akivili's disappearance was very mysterious. Nous is probably the only one that can answer that question. After all, Droidhead knows everything.

speaker: Kafka
line: ▶ What do you think, (Trailblazer)? Fascinating stories, no?

speaker: Kafka
line: They're the kind of stories that folks on the straight and narrow would never tell you.

text: What about the third way?
Why are you telling me this?
Do you believe all this nonsense?

speaker: Kafka
line: ...Hold on, any minute now.

speaker: Kafka
line: Aha, it's begun!

text: (Cutsceneplays)

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Let's go, Bladie.

children.speaker: Kafka
children.line: Two more places to visit.

text: (Cutscene ends)

speaker: March 7th
line: Did Kafka escape? Argh, how are we gonna explain this to the master diviner!?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ If what she said is true, we won't have to explain anything...

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Hey, did she brainwash you!?

text: Find Fu Xuan and Jing Yuan and report to them about the Ambrosial Arbor's strange resurrection.

title: Step Description
content: You learn from your conversation with Kafka that the Stellaron Hunters aim to "slay Aeons." Can mortals as powerless as dust harm the gods, which appear as grand as celestial bodies?Kafka does not answer and simply gazes into the distance, as if she had already predicted the current scourge. The divine construct, the Ambrosial Arbor, has been revived in the depths of a distant delve and threatens to pierce the sky after having withered millennia ago. The Stellaron Hunter then departs, leaving you alone in your confusion.

text: (Tingyun idle text, when stepping onto the bridge)
What a spectacular view...
That is true even for long-life species
(Approach Tingyun)

speaker: March 7th
line: Wasn't this the dead tree Qingque showed us earlier? How did it grow all of a sudden?

speaker: Tingyun
line: Amazing, absolutely amazing! Even the long-lived might not witness something like this in their lifetime! I'm so lucky!

text: Maybe someone applied a strong fertilizer?
The Ambrosial Arbor was imbued with some kind of power...

speaker: Welt
line: Such extraordinary energy... It's the Stellaron.

speaker: March 7th
line: Mr. Yang, do you mean... the Stellaron is making the Ambrosial Arbor grow?

speaker: Welt
line: Yes, the Stellaron the Cloud Knights are searching for must be causing this anomaly!

text: (NPC idle quotes while walking towards the next marked location)
(Entering the first gate, left two NPCs)
Ambro... The Ambrosial Arbor is reborn!
How could this happen?
(Entering the first gate, right two NPCs)
What I heard just now...
Did you see that... that tree?
(Approach designated spot)

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Unless Kafka deceived the Matrix of Prescience...

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Stay calm, Diviner Fu, the Matrix of Prescience does not lie. The logic you have laid out concerning Kafka makes sense — it has helped me to fill in another piece of the puzzle.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: I agree there is a hostile external force at work on the Luofu. The Stellaron didn't appear out of thin air — someone managed to sneak it onto the ship. As for the culprits behind the Luofu's internal strife, I believe we are dealing with the so-called Disciples of Sanctus Medicus — that shadowy organization of the Denizens of Abundance .

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Kafka's revelations confirm my suspicions.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: You... General, when did you have these suspicions?

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: The moment the planter of the Stellaron revealed themself. The Xianzhou has the blessing of the Reignbow Arbiter — only another Aeon's Emanator would be capable of sneaking onto this ship without my knowing. We are dealing with an external threat.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: The Stellaron corrosion continues to flood into the ship, and yet it bypassed both the Seat of Divine Foresight and The Shackling Prison ... there is forethought here — our enemy must have had access to Luofu intelligence for things to unfold in this way. It is evident now...

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: The Stellaron Hunters aren't the ones behind the curtain... No, as soon as I set eyes on Blade, it was clear to me. But why is he here, and why did he draw the Astral Express? ...That piece of the puzzle still eludes me.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Nevertheless, Lady Fu, your intel means the puzzle is more complete than it was before, haha. These Stellaron Hunters are a captivating group — such lengths to get the Xianzhou and the Express onto the same track. Who would've believed it?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: General, we must retain all urgency! The Ambrosial Arbor...

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: It's the Stellaron. No need to search high and low — the traitors have planted it in the Ambrosial Arbor's delve, thereby causing the tree to grow once again. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus couldn't hold off any longer.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Every crisis is a turning point. A problem is easier to resolve when you know where it lies.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ...Am I coming up with the plan again?

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Of course, I'm sure you have a countermeasure at the ready, Master Diviner.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: From my perspective, convening the Cloud Knights is our immediate priority. We must head into the roots of the Ambrosial Arbor, expel the Stellaron spirits, and prevent the Arbor's resurrection.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Mhmm, as ever the master diviner's omniscia provides the fastest solution. However, sometimes speed is not everything. I have known the Stellaron's location for a while now, so why have I held back our forces?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: General.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Well?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ...You're a scoundrel.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Haha, pulling up the grass requires removing the roots. The Disciples of Sanctus Medicus have chosen to make their move now, which means the Cloud Knights have the situation under control and the traitors have run out of patience. Now is the time to capture them all in one fell swoop.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: You've been sitting on that this whole time? How will you justify the losses if something goes wrong, General!?

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Please, Lady Fu, I still have forces to deploy.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: We were in need of extra hands, and the Stellaron Hunters were kind enough to bring us together with the Astral Express — how could I look the other way.

text: Listen up! We've got a situation!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: That massive tree has suddenly sprung to life!

text: Let me guess, more errands?

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: The general's smiling again — definitely errands...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: It's my fault. I had higher expectations of the general...

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Please! We can't keep getting them to do everything for us! Since when did we run out of people on the Luofu?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: You... Why are you staring at me?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Do I need to remind you, general, that the Ambrosial Arbor's access point is a closely guarded secret? Allowing outworlders would be—

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: A violation of the rules and regulations. I would like to remind you, Lady Fu, that the Xianzhou comes before its rules and regulations — all the more so in times of crisis.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: As such, I am about to make a decision that runs counter to those rules and regulations. Oh, uh — decisions, plural. Haha, what a rare pleasure.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Lady Fu, I hereby issue you with the military tally — the Cloud Knights will be under your control. You will act in concert with the other forces in the approach to the Ambrosial Arbor through the Alchemy Commission delve.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Under... my control?

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: You've been eager to discover for yourself what it is to be a general, have you not?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: You've never given me the opportunity, and now suddenly... Understood, as you wish.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: As for our Astral friends... I hereby formally welcome you all to join our operation to seal the Stellaron.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Lady Fu will deploy the Cloud Knights, but I would like you to set off in advance. Take a shortcut through the Artisanship Commission and convene with Lady Fu further down the line.

text: Orders received, General.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: This is no order, honored guests. I am merely stating what needs to be done, should you wish to help us.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: You've never really seen us as outsiders, huh.

text: Errands received, General.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: This is no errand, honored guests. I am merely stating what needs to be done, should you wish to help us.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: You've never really seen us as outsiders, huh.

text: Payment, or we go on strike!

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Understood, understood, worry not — I know how to repay a favor.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: The Xianzhou has met with a dramatic chain of events, and each of you has chosen to stand by us. Your fearlessness moves me.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Nevertheless, the enemy is upon us and time is of the essence — let us not allow monetary affairs to cast a shadow over more pressing matters.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Once catastrophe has been averted, we shall discuss this in greater detail.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: Miss Tingyun, I would like you to continue to serve as a guide for our Astral friends.

speaker: Tingyun
line: ...Of course general, I am duty-bound.

text: Bid farewell to Fu Xuan

title: Step Description
content: The revival of the Ambrosial Arbor makes the location of the Stellaron on the Luofu abundantly clear, but the culprit of this disaster remains obscure.Fu Xuan is tasked to lead the Cloud Knights and keep watch over the Alchemy Commission delve next to the Ambrosial Arbor. As for you, based on the principle that a good tool should be used until it breaks — Errr, that the reward for hard work is more work! Jing Yuan asks you to find out what is happening in the radio-silent Artisanship Commission, and head to the Alchemy Commission via a shortcut.

text: (Talk to Jing Yuan, optional)

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: The Alchemy Commission and Scalegorge Waterscape delves are adjacent to the Ambrosial Arbor's seal. I'd like you to investigate these places.

text: What exactly is the Ambrosial Arbor?

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: It is an ancient artifact that was planted on the Xianzhou Luofu by Yaoshi, the Aeon of Abundance. It has the power to shape life and subdue death at will.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: The ancestors of the Luofu people consumed the fruits of the Ambrosial Arbor and gained endless lifespans — thus becoming long-life species.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Sounds like an amazing treasure!

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Yes... it was also the bane of everything to come.

text: Aren't you happy about the Ambrosial Arbor's resurrection?

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: As outsiders, you are unfamiliar with the history of the Xianzhou. I cannot blame you for asking a question like this. Let me tell you a story.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Long ago, before the Xianzhou took to the skies, our ancestors lived on the surface of a planet. Like all of you, the Xianzhou people at that time were a mortal species with a lifespan of fewer than 100 years.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: There was a time when the ruling emperor could not bear his temporary existence, or the thought of his life's achievements being lost to another after his death. He became fixated on acquiring an elixir of immortality, and focused his power on constructing a fleet of nine ships. These ships would voyage into deep space, where traces of gods were rumored to exist...

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Did he... succeed?

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Yes, and no. He succeeded because, after an arduous journey, the nine ships eventually witnessed the manifestation of a god — Yaoshi's appearance provided for all manner of unfathomable celestial blessings... However, he failed because the fleet has been lost ever since, and has never been able to return to its home planet.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: That doesn't sound so bad. The Xianzhou people went on a great adventure and got what they wanted in the end, right?

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Oh...? Our ancestors once thought so too, but the miracle of longevity was nothing more than a vain dream.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Take the Luofu, for example — immortality seemed like a beautiful thing. But what followed was population expansion and diminishing resources. In the struggle for survival, the immortals lost their humanity and degenerated into mere beasts.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: After paying the price with blood and tears, the Luofu people finally understood that immortality was not a free blessing, but the beginning of a cruel ordeal.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: In the eras that followed, other beings that had likewise received Yaoshi's blessings repeatedly attacked the Xianzhou in an attempt to take the sacred artifact as their own. Countless atrocities were committed as a result.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Many Xianzhou comrades who were lucky enough to survive the wars became stricken with mara — a condition that immortals are susceptible to.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Had it not been for the enlightenment and protection of the Reignbow Arbiter , the Xianzhou Alliance you see today would never have existed.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: At this point in the story, I assume you understand the disasters that the resurrection of the Ambrosial Arbor might bring about?

text: You said there were traitors inside the Luofu?

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Thousands of years have passed since the Reignbow Arbiter felled the Ambrosial Arbor.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Most in the Xianzhou regard the Arbor as nothing more than the stump of a dead tree... Only those familiar with our history and the ancient texts know of its origin.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Our ancestors placed the stump in full view of the people precisely to make it seem unimportant, but in fact, they sealed it behind layers upon layers of delve enchantment. Even if one travels toward the Ambrosial Arbor, one will never reach it.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: Someone brought a Stellaron into the Xianzhou and planted it among the roots of the Ambrosial Arbor. They wish to resurrect it and achieve their hidden goal through external aggression.

children.speaker: Jing Yuan
children.line: In my opinion, the force that provided the Stellaron and the force that activated it have different objectives.

text: Let's delay no longer. We should be moving.

speaker: Jing Yuan
line: I have asked Fu Xuan to open a shortcut to the Divination Commission for you.

text: (Talk to Tingyun, optional)

speaker: Tingyun
line: *sigh* I thought I might be relieved of my guiding duties once the Divination Commission affair was over...

speaker: Tingyun
line: Who would've thought the general would take such a liking to you? I suppose I must accompany you further... Fate can be so unpredictable.

text: Through thick and thin, we're like two peas in a dangerous pod.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: You have quite the sense of humor, benefactors... I've encountered more trouble with you than I have with the merchant fleet in ten years.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: I just hope everything is smooth-sailing from now on — please look after me.

text: This could be your moment to shine for the Sky-Faring Commission .

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: I understand. The Luofu is in danger, and members of the six commissions should stand united.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: *sigh* You did save my life at Cloudford ... Consider this my returning the favor.

text: Are you afraid of the danger, Miss Tingyun?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: The general said there are traitors aboard the ship.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: But only someone from the six commissions could bring the Stellaron into the Xianzhou undetected, let alone plant it within the Ambrosial Arbor...

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: I am saying nothing of the sort, just raising a doubt, that's all. Please be careful, benefactors...

text: If there's nothing else, we should get going.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Y—You want to leave straight away? Let me pack some things. I'll be right there.

text: (Talk to Qingque, optional)

speaker: Qingque
line: Phew, that was scary. I was having a snack in the repository when the Ambrosial Arbor started to grow — the trunk suddenly shot right up into the sky. So the legends were right all along...

speaker: Qingque
line: Such is life, full of surprises. That's why you gotta seize any opportunity to take a break — who knows when trouble will come knocking at your door.

text: Given what you just saw, you don't seem rattled at all.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: It'll be fine. Even if the sky collapses, we have the master diviner with us to hold it up. Oh, and now we have the general here too.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: What do subordinates like us have to panic about? Let the big shots worry about the big events. That's the secret to happiness.

text: Didn't the master diviner give you any work to do?

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: She did — she saw me on her way over. She told me to go to the repository and read up on anything related to the Ambrosial Arbor.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: A simple task like that is only fifteen minutes' work for me.

children.speaker: Qingque
children.line: I heard people say even the general has to watch his manners when asking you for help — pretty impressive! I don't have much to offer you... Uh, here! Take this book. It's the thought that counts!

text: We've gotta get going.

speaker: Qingque
line: I was gonna wait for the master diviner to get off work so I could show you around and teach Mr. Yang how to play celestial jade .

speaker: Welt
line: Your kindness is much appreciated, Miss Qingque. As for celestial jade, we'll have to leave it for next time.

speaker: Qingque
line: I know, I know, you've got an important task ahead... sorry to keep you. Priorities are priorities.

speaker: Qingque
line: Well then, get back safely. Remember to come find me in Exalting Sanctum !

text: (Talk to Fu Xuan)

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: A step forward bridges no distance hence... Ugh, the hexagram was right.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: The Ambrosial Arbor was felled thousands of years ago... now it returns to life. The future of Xianzhou is difficult to divine.

text: I'm sorry... Kafka escaped.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: I had long anticipated it.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Huh? She's not angry? *sigh* Is there anyone that isn't two steps ahead of us around here?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: Pursuing Kafka is a waste of time and effort — The Matrix of Prescience informed me of her innocence. Our priority is the Ambrosial Arbor.

text: Are you leading forces into the Alchemy Commission?

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: From the time the Stellaron corrosion began to spread until now, the only reports we've received on the Alchemy Commission have come from alchemists and doctors stationed in other delves.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: The Alchemy Commission is where the Xianzhou's medical research and production take place. However, due to its proximity to the Ambrosial Arbor's seal, I'm afraid the Stellaron spirits may have plunged it into a deeper crisis than we first feared.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: To make matters worse, the general suspects there are traitors in the Alchemy Commission. The self-proclaimed Disciples of Sanctus Medicus have been plotting this for a long time — now they're using the location to their advantage. I must take action as soon as possible.

text: The general wants us to go to the Artisanship Commission...

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: He really is a delegator at heart, isn't he... There isn't much distance between the Artisanship and Alchemy Commissions — I'm afraid the former is likely also facing imminent catastrophe.

children.speaker: Fu Xuan
children.line: The starskiff is ready — I will lead the way.

text: Um, I wanna chat with others as well.
Follow Fu Xuan to the Divination Commission's dock
(If the player moves too far away from Fu Xuan)

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), where are you going? The starskiff is ahead of us — follow my lead.

text: (Approach the dock)

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: I still have important tasks from the general to attend to. Go carefully, all of you.

speaker: March 7th
line: Wait, wait! Master Diviner, can you divine our fortunes for us? Is there anything we need to watch out for?

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: ...No need.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: My omniscia has seen that your journey will be auspicious — everything will proceed smoothly.

speaker: March 7th
line: A—Are you sure? You don't need to use a crazy device or do more finger-counting?

text: I'm sure it's nothing we can't manage. Let's go!

speaker: Welt
line: ▶ Well said, (Trailblazer). Thank you for your assurance, Master Diviner. Onward.

text: (Talk to Fu Xuan, optional)

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: What's the delay? If you're worried about the road ahead, I've already told you — the hexagram indicates an auspicious result.

speaker: Fu Xuan
line: Don't believe me? Fine. Fate is fickle — better to believe in yourself than look to the sky.

text: Leave the Divination Commission and take a skiff to go to the Artisanship Commission
(Upon entering the Artisanship Commission)

speaker: Tingyun
line: Huh? Look at all the people gathered here... Not a good day for commuting on the Luofu.

speaker: Tingyun
line: The Artisanship Commission delve should have suspended operations after the Stellaron corrosion began. Why haven't these people taken starskiffs to safety?

speaker: March 7th
line: Maybe the Artisanship Commission are just more dedicated to their work? The Divination Commission's diviners aren't exactly a hard act to follow...

speaker: Welt
line: *sigh* At the end of the day, work is work — you need it to live. Y'know March, adults forget what "relaxation" means after a certain age, hehe...

speaker: March 7th
line: Sounds like you're speaking from experience...

speaker: Welt
line: Just speaking from the heart, that's all.

text: The Path of Trailblaze doesn't seem to allow for any "relaxation" either.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: I think they call that "complaining from the heart."

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Are any of the Paths in this world easy to tread?

text: Maybe they're here to welcome us?

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: That's it~! First you arrive out of the blue, then the general recruits you to the cause — it's like the stories where imperial heroes bring salvation to the world.

children.speaker: Tingyun
children.line: Still, it doesn't look like they're rolling out the red carpet... We might be getting ahead of ourselves.

speaker: Tingyun
line: The Artisanship Commission is full of workshops, buildings, state-of-the-art mechanisms, and craftsmen designing brand-new concepts.

speaker: Tingyun
line: Periodically stirring up trouble is part of their tradition... entire buildings vanishing into thin air, puppet riots — you get the picture.

speaker: Tingyun
line: It seems like the craftsmen are too afraid to go in, but they have nowhere to run to either. We should take care, benefactors — something terrible must have happened.

speaker: Welt
line: Either way, we'll have to go in. Let's ask around first.
